intro: Pilea johnstonii subsp. rwandensis, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to eastern Africa, particularly Rwanda, and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in umbels and appear during the wet season. It prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
